item.description:
I've been hitting some of the other, non-AMC 4,000+ foot prominences and features in the Northern Presis for a while. These mountains are a playground for explorers! 

This will not be your traditional peakbagging climb.  There are much more direct ways to bag the peaks that we will pass and bagging Jefferson is not the ultimate goal.  While this hike will NOT be leisurely (due to the distance and difficulty), you should be willing to take some time to take in the views. 

We will ascend Jefferson via the Isreal Ridge Path to the Edmands Col.   

From the Edmands Col, we will take the to the Gulfside Trail to Six Husbands and ascend to the summit of Jefferson.  Then we will double back to the Gulfside Trail and circle the summit of Jefferson along the Gulfside Trail and the Cornice, stopping off the Gulfside Trail to scramble up the Monticello Lawn Peak (a sub-summit of Jefferson).  The return route will depend on the footing - I'd like to return via the Castle Ravine Trail but it may be too slippery to do so.  If

 

Without having done this hike, I can't tell precisely how long it will take.  It will be a long day.  I will update this write-up tomorrow with some more specific times and distances. Jefferson is one of the high peaks in the Whites and on the list of NH/White Mountain 48 4,000 footers.  Monticello Lawn Peak is a 4000+ foot prominence but not on the AMC list.

-------------------------

Be prepared for cool, cold, wet and potentially poor weather conditions. DO NOT WEAR COTTON OR DENIM. If you have questions about how to prepare or how to dress, ask them in advance.  Come prepared to stay dry!!

Answers to FAQs

  • This IS NOT a traverse, so we will NOT need to carpool to another location.
  • We will meet in the Castle Trail Trail Head on Route 2 
  • Sunset will be at  about 6:17 pm.
  • This hike will be VERY EXPOSED.  Come prepared for sun, rain and cold exposure.
  • We will pass The Perch (RMC cabin) on this climb.  We will NOT pass any AMC huts.
  • Bring enough water.  
  • Headlamps are required.  I do not plan to come out in the dark, but this is a long hike and one of the tougher mountains, so I want hikers to be prepared.  The last two hikes I did in the Northern Presis came out in the dark.  Always be prepared to come out in the dark if necessary.
  • We will START AND FINISH TOGETHER. If you cannot hold your speed down to match that of the group (if necessary), this is not the hike for you.   I require participants to wait at trail junctions, major water crossings and summits so that the group can exchange information and reset their pace.
  • I am NOT a fast hiker, but I do keep a steady pace.  I'm doing about book time these days.
  • If the conditions are prohibitive, I have no qualms about turning around. The mountain will be there another day.  I would like you to be around for another day too.
  • My hikes area always dog friendly, but please know the limits and abilities of your dog & bring plenty of water.  The Northern Presis can be very hard on a dog's feet.  I will NOT have my dogs with me.
  • I will watch the weather carefully and post weather updates during the week leading up to the hike. I rely on NOAA and MWObs for my forecasts.
  • I will provide attendees with my cell phone number in advance of the hike.

Most of the payoff comes in the form of great views & enjoying the outdoors.  If the weather looks like it will be miserable, I will reschedule.  Please plan accordingly.

RSVP Questions are NOT optional - If you do not provide me with a phone number to try and contact you on the morning of the hike (if necessary), we will NOT wait for you at the trailhead.

Book time is hard to estimate for this one.  Book time as listed below does not take into account the ascent of Monticello Lawn Peak or stopping.   Plan on it taking about AT LEAST this long & possibly a little more since we intend to spend some time at the true summit.  Last week we did a similar ascent of 4 summits on Adams and still made 1 hour under book time, even with several stops.

 

"Plagerized" Trail Descriptions  from the AMC Guide will follow shortly 
----------------------------------------------------------  
Copyright © the Appalachian Mountain Club. All rights reserved do not distribute

 

Castle Trail to Isreal Ridge

1.3 miles

50 minutes


Isreal Ridge to Edmands Col via Randolph

3.5 miles

3 hours, 15 minutes


Gulfside Trail to Six Husbands

.5 miles

30 minutes


Six Husbands/Gulfside Junction to the Summit of Jefferson (Round Trip)

.6 miles

40 minutes 

 

Six Husbands/Gulfisde Trail Junction to the Cornice

.5 miles

15 minutes


Cornice to Castle Ravine

1.8 miles

1 hour 10 minutes


 

Castle Ravine to Link to Israel Ridge (Tentative)

2.5 miles

2 hours

 

Isreal Ridge Path to Castle Trail

1.2 miles

1 hour, 5 minutes

 

Castle Trail to Trail Head

1.3 miles

50 minutes


Totals  
--------  
13.2 miles  

9 hours, 35 minutes


DISCLAIMER (SHAMELESSLY PLAGERIZED FROM ANOTHER MEETUP HIKER): MY ROLE AS ORGANIZER IN THIS HIKE IS SOCIAL. I AM NOT TRAINED TO BE A GUIDE, NOR HAVE I RECEIVED TRAINING OR INSTRUCTION IN HIKING SAFETY. WHILE I TRY TO HEAD OFF SOME OF THE PROBLEMS I HAVE SEEN (OR EXPERIENCED OR EVEN CAUSED) IN THE PAST, MY UNDERSTANDING IS THAT YOU WILL TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY. IF MY DISAPPEARANCE DURING THIS TRIP WOULD CAUSE YOU MORE THAN ANNOYANCE AND INCONVENIENCE, THIS IS NOT THE TRIP FOR YOU. THERE ARE ALWAYS RISKS IN HIKING IN THE MOUNTAINS. IF YOU ARE NOT CONFIDENT THAT YOU UNDERSTAND THE RISKS, PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP (or change your RSVP to no). WHILE I HAVE CLIMBED THIS PEAK BEFORE, I HAVE DONE ALL MY RESEARCH VIA GUIDEBOOKS, INTERNET AND ADVICE FROM OTHER HIKERS, SO IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOME INFORMATION IS NOT ACCURATE. I AM PERFECTLY CAPABLE OF MAKING STUPID OR MINDLESS MISTAKES, SO PLEASE DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH AND COME PREPARED WITH APPROPRIATE KNOWLEDGE, EQUIPMENT AND JUDGMENT.
item.name: Northern Presi Playground: Jefferson and Monticello Lawn Peak
